feed.title: Snooker Blog
feed.subtitle: The snooker is an amazing game!

entry.title: Murphy Stunned By China’s Chen
entry.content:
Shaun Murphy, champion ten years ago, suffered a shock 6-3 defeat against world number 124 Chen Feilong in the first round of the Betway UK Championship.

Murphy has had a disappointing start to the 2018/19 campaign, failing to go beyond the last 16 of a ranking event, but this was the most surprising defeat of his season so far. He took the UK title in 2008 and was runner-up in 2012 and 2017, but this time the world number nine misses out on the TV stages in York.
entry.summary: Shaun Murphy, champion ten years ago, suffered a shock 6-3 defeat against world number 124 Chen Feilong in the first round of the Betway UK Championship.

entry.title: Lucky Higgins Edges Out Poomjaeng
entry.content:
After the shock exits of Shaun Murphy and Ryan Day earlier in the day Higgins looked in danger of becoming another high profile casualty in the first round in York when he frittered away leads of 4-1 and 5-3. He made a break of 101 in the fourth frame but otherwise struggled for fluency as Thailand’s Poomjaeng battled back to 5-5.

Amateur cueman Poomjaeng had two early chances in the deciding frame but missed one red to a centre pocket and another to a baulk corner. Gritty Higgins made a crucial break of 60 which proved enough for victory in a match which finished at 12.30am. Three-time UK Champion Higgins now faces a tartan tussle against Alan McManus in the last 64.

“That’s the way I have been playing all season, it’s no surprise to me how badly I struggled there,” said 43-year-old Higgins. “I was really lucky because Dechawat had a good chance in the last frame, if he had potted the red to the middle I would have fancied him to make a frame-winning break because all the balls were there.
entry.summary: After the shock exits of Shaun Murphy and Ryan Day earlier in the day Higgins looked in danger of becoming another high profile casualty in the first round in York when he frittered away leads of 4-1 and 5-3. He made a break of 101 in the fourth frame but otherwise struggled for fluency as Thailand’s Poomjaeng battled back to 5-5.

entry.title: Weekend Schedule In York
entry.content:
The match schedule for Saturday and Sunday at the Betway UK Championship is taking shape.

Snooker’s top stars are at the York Barbican competing for the first Triple Crown title of the season. The tournament runs until December 9 and tickets are still available for most sessions.
entry.summary: The match schedule for Saturday and Sunday at the Betway UK Championship is taking shape.

entry.title: BetVictor Scottish Open Draw
entry.content:
The tournament at the Glasgow Emirates runs from December 10 to 16 with 128 players battling for the Stephen Hendry Trophy.

Among the star names in the draw are Ronnie O’Sullivan, Judd Trump, Shaun Murphy, Mark Allen, Ding Junhui, home favourite John Higgins and defending champion Neil Robertson.

Tickets are available now and start at just £10 – for details click here. Take advantage of our Black Friday offer with selected tickets at just £5!
entry.summary: The tournament at the Glasgow Emirates runs from December 10 to 16 with 128 players battling for the Stephen Hendry Trophy.

entry.title: Watch snooker on Eurosport Player
entry.content:
Snooker fans throughout Europe can watch the sport anywhere and on any device on Eurosport Player, the leading live and on-demand digital sport platform.

Eurosport Player is available to download and watch in 52 markets and in 20 languages, offering fans an all-access pass to immerse themselves in the greatest events on the global sporting calendar.

With live and on-demand content available any time, fans can experience sport in the way that they enjoy best and access enhanced live features, such as additional feeds and camera angles.
entry.summary: Snooker fans throughout Europe can watch the sport anywhere and on any device on Eurosport Player, the leading live and on-demand digital sport platform.

entry.title: Trump – I Need The Big Titles

link.title: Trump – I Need The Big Titles

entry.content:
Judd Trump hopes he can keep his hot streak of form going as he looks ahead to the Betway UK Championship in York.

Trump won last week’s Northern Ireland Open in Belfast, his first ranking title in over a year. He won seven matches, culminating in a superb 9-7 defeat of Ronnie O’Sullivan in the final.
entry.summary: Judd Trump hopes he can keep his hot streak of form going as he looks ahead to the Betway UK Championship in York.
